comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think the large clipper ship is the 'Great Victoria' built in France in 1854, rebuilt in 1864. (ref - jamesobrien.id.au/genealogy/james-obrien-and-mary-smith/g... )

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Pre 1891 when more ferry jetties were built where the "Great Victoria" is berthed.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Apologies -  I have not updated the information for this photo.  It is NOT the 'Great Victoria' but the 'Torridon' and the year is 1888.  Probably 26/1/1888.  See comments and research -
 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362661905/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2495797591/]
